content:
Sathyabhama Das Biju, born in May 1963, is a renowned Indian amphibian biologist and wildlife conservationist, often referred to as the “Frogman of India.” He heads the Systematics Lab at the University of Delhi’s Department of Environmental Studies and is recognized for his significant contributions to amphibian research, including the discovery of over 100 new species and two new families of amphibians. Biju has received numerous accolades for his work, including the Sanctuary Wildlife Service Award and the Kerala Sree Award. His passion for amphibians and dedication to conservation have made him a leading figure in the field.
Join us for an engaging program,
Event : "Talk with Dr. S D Biju"
Date : September 5, 2024, at 4 PM 
Venue : Sahitya Akademi Hall, Thrissur.
Everyone is welcome to attend this insightful discussion with Sathyabhama Das Biju, where he will share his experiences and knowledge about amphibian conservation and research. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn from one of the world’s foremost amphibian experts!
summary: Sathyabhama Das Biju, born in May 1963, is a renowned Indian amphibian biologist and wildlife conservationist, often referred to as the “Frogman of India.” He heads the Systematics Lab at the University of Delhi’s Department of Environmental Studies and is recognized for his significant contributions to amphibian research, including the discovery of over 100 new species and two new families of amphibians.
title: Evening with Dr. S D Biju

content:
National Moth Week celebrates the beauty, life cycles, and habitats of moths. NMW 2024 will be held worldwide from July 20-28. Moth-ers of all ages and abilities are encouraged to learn about, observe, and document moths in their backyards, parks, and neighborhoods. NMW Kerala Trying to biring active mothing community with Moth-ers of Kerala, KBMN and other organisations.
 More about moths & mothing in kerala
Kerala Event Map  Social Media  Join NMW2024 iNat Project https://www.inaturalist.org/projects/national-moth-week-2024-kerala/ Register Your (Public/Private) mothing events here. Event Map  Facebook Event Hashtags #NMWKerala  NMW Kerala Programs Moth Art Moth Night Quiz Press NMW 2024 Malayalam Flyer

title: National Moth Week 2024 Kerala - Exploring Nighttime Nature

National Moth Week celebrates the beauty, life cycles, and habitats of moths. NMW 2021 will be held worldwide from July 17-25. Moth-ers of all ages and abilities are encouraged to learn about, observe, and document moths in their backyards, parks, and neighborhoods. NMW Kerala Trying to biring active mothing community with Moth-ers of Kerala, KBMN and other organisations.
More about moths & mothing in kerala

 Wikipedia Editathon This is a experiment effort to create/enrich informations about Indian Moths in Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia. A primary wiki list is prepared by user:Manojk (based on Balakrishan Valappil’s Kerala Checklist) and metapage here here.
In celebration of #mothweek I picked a red-linked moth from @manojkmohan list: https://t.co/wVkjlJPX48 and wrote: https://t.co/ic68gGCA2J reusing a compatible licensed photo from #iNaturalist
— Andra Waagmeester (@andrawaag) July 21, 2021  Wikidata In preparation for the #Wikipedia @WikipediaWeekly Biodiversity broadcast (tomorrow NZ time) I've just drafted up a document showing how I structure a moth #Wikidata item. Let me know if you think I've missed anything! #AotearoaMothWeek #MothWeek https://t.co/itkVxxpVBd

content:
The Big Butterfly Month is a celebration of butterflies aimed at conducting a nationwide citizen science survey to help us assess the health of our environment. BBM Kerala BioBlitz This campaign coducted by iNat Kerala Community & KBMN. Upload your obseservation to iNaturalist.org https://www.inaturalist.org/projects/big-butterfly-month-2021-kerala
Webinars ശലഭത്താരയിലേക്ക് (Into the Butterfly Corridor)
VC Balakrishnan (Shalabhathara & SEEK)
Saturday, September 25 · 7:00PM Google Meet https://meet.google.com/avi-twcq-sya
(Poster by Bibeesh Balakrishnan)
Butterfly Count This year we have 2 ways for you to submit Butterfly Count data to us:
 https://bigbutterflymonth.in/  Previous Years   2020
summary: The Big Butterfly Month is a celebration of butterflies aimed at conducting a nationwide citizen science survey to help us assess the health of our environment. BBM Kerala BioBlitz This campaign coducted by iNat Kerala Community & KBMN.
title: Big Butterfly Month 2021 Kerala
